intro: Jussiaea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Jussiaea longipes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to wet conditions.
